edu.cmu.cs.cs214.hw5.core

Interface DataPlugin


  • public interface DataPlugin
    Interface implemented by Data Plugins in order to fetch data from an external source and import it into the framework.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.Collection<ClientPoint> getCollection(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> argumentMap)
      The client implements this method to fetch the data from the data source.
      java.lang.String getName()
      The name this plugin will be displayed with in the framework for purposes of selection and loading.
      java.util.List<java.lang.String> getPopupParameters()
      The client is expected to provide a list of desired input strings, in order to parameterize data and provide plugin-specific or use-specific information (e.g.

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
        The name this plugin will be displayed with in the framework for purposes of selection and loading.
        Returns:
        name string

      • getPopupParameters

        java.util.List<java.lang.String> getPopupParameters()
        The client is expected to provide a list of desired input strings, in order to parameterize data and provide plugin-specific or use-specific information (e.g. file path). Each parameter string will be associated with a text field in a popup. A result is expected for each of these, which the plugin can then choose to use or disregard.
        Returns:
        list of field labels.

      • getCollection

        java.util.Collection<ClientPoint> getCollection(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> argumentMap)
                                         throws java.lang.Exception
        The client implements this method to fetch the data from the data source. The client is provided the results of the getPopupParameters they implemented earlier in the form of a mapping from key (parameter field label) to value (input result from client). The client is then responsible for validating these parameters.
        Parameters:
        argumentMap - map from field parameters to client-provided arguments
        Returns:
        collection of Points ready to be input into the framework
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if there was an I/O or parsing error (FileNotFound, I/O Exception, ParseException). The framework will display an appropriate error to the user.
